Reviews.Title: great television
Reviews.Author: Michael Chesack
Reviews.Content: Have had this tv for 1 month so far it has been great, excellent picture especially in blue ray the 3D feature is great as well, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Love Both Our LG TVs
Reviews.Author: ladyfingers
Reviews.Content: This is the second LG TV we've gotten through Amazon.  Both TVs arrived in excellent condition and presented no delivery problems.  Setting up the LG 47GA7900 was easy, although we didn't follow manufacturer instructions that said to lay the TV on its face while installing the stand.  Not wanting to put any pressure on the LED-LCD screen, one person held it vertically on one side while the other person screwed the stand into the back of the TV.  The 47" TV only weighs 32 lbs and is easy enough for two people to handle safely.  The stand is attractive and provides solid TV support.We connected a Charter cable box (manufactured by Motorola), a Sony Blu-Ray player using HDMI cables and a Samsung sound bar using an optical cable. This package includes an "IR blaster" cable with two IR transmitters that need to be positioned in front of the components' IR receivers.  The IR blaster allows you to use the LG remote to access some of the functions of the components.  We placed one IR blaster transmitter in front of our cable box and the other in front of our Blu-ray player.  We were never able to control the Samsung sound bar using the LG remote.  The sound bar works fine, we just need to use the Samsung remote to control the volume and sound bar features.  The TV easily found and connected to our home wireless network router.The gesture wii-style function seems to move the cursor arrow in unpredictable directions, so we try to use the arrow cursor keys for screen navigation whenever possible.  Finding and adjusting settings takes some searching.  After changing the screen brightness and setting the screen size ratio to automatically sense and adjust according to the given input signal format, we now have a beautiful picture.  The qwerty keyboard on one side of the remote is great for entering words or URL's in the Google Chrome browser.  Unfortunately, LG chose to write some of the functions in red font on small black keys that are next to impossible to read (lights/magnifying glass help).  The voice search is interesting and useful, but not always accurate.  For example, it kept finding "Prime" this and that when we clearly and repeatedly enunciated John Prine.  That doesn't happen too often, though.  Its quick ability to search TV and web for basically anything we want more than makes up for a few idiosyncrasies.  The remote works well for controlling the TV, but the IR blaster is a poor substitute for either the components' manufacturers' remote controls or a well designed multi-component remote control like Logitech makes.The picture quality of this TV is absolutely beautiful in 2D or 3D.  The built in speakers are adequate but an additional sound system is recommended for better theater quality sound.  The home screen is easy to navigate, but watching how-to videos on LG's website for a more complete picture also might help.The Google TV platform has many applications for gaming and access to movies and TV programs that mostly require subscriptions to view.  Our Google Chrome TV experience is much different than using the computer web browser on our PC.  We are still exploring the many ways to access content and figure out what our family likes best.For those who aren't ready for or don't want Google TV features, we highly recommend LG Cinema Screen 55LM7600 55-Inch Cinema 3D 1080p 240Hz LED-LCD HDTV with Smart TV and Six Pairs of 3D Glasses.  This TV has the same beautiful picture quality, is cheaper and offers many similar features.  Because it lacks voice and keypad controls, the search process is a bit slower, but nonetheless it's a wonderful TV.  Don't be afraid to buy via Amazon--we were initially hesitant to get costly electronics through Amazon, but each transaction has gone perfectly from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV , really top quality
Reviews.Author: KJ
Reviews.Content: I've had the TV for a few months now and couldn't be more pleased. The 47" screen is perfect if you want a large screen but not something that will dominate a medium sized room. The minimalist look of the bezel gives it a popular modern look and the lighted logo on the bottom adds a little finesse. The Google TV integration is a very nice touch and after the initial setup is fairly user friendly and intuitive. The screen quality is top tier and probably one of the best edge lit led screens you will find. LG packed a whole host of customizable options to tweak the picture to your liking and presets for those who would rather use one touch picture and sound tuning. Internet and android os works well and adds many features to this smart TV. Plenty of input options, both wired and wireless. The sound quality of the stock speakers are the best I've heard on a large flat screen TV, they're at least comparable to the older box style TV speakers that have depth to the audio and not weak and flat sounding like most modern flat screens. The remote really makes this TV with its built in mouse pointer, full qwerty keyboard and voice input. The pros of this TV easily out weigh any cons. Some of the cons I ran into was I wish the mouse pointer had an option to adjust amount of time it stayed on screen before rehitting the call button for it. This however can be remedied by using a wireless mouse with TV if you wish. QWERTY keyboard should be background lit and better choice of color for special key characters used, you do get used to it in time though. You have to use IR blasters to sync remote with up to two other devices. It will run about 90% of what my cable box is capable of doing which is great, but the missing 10% can be annoying. I can't get my Polk Audio sound bar to either sync with my TV or remote. So I have to adjust it separately from tv audio. This is just a compatibility issue between this model of TV and this model of sound bar, most separate audio systems shouldn't have this issue. One other thing is the lack of very many apps in the android market for this operating system yet. I do feel this will change as time goes on however. Again however, these are minor annoyances at worst and the pros of what this TV is and does is greatly out weighed by these pros.

Reviews.Title: Lots of bells and whistles but not the right ones (for me)
Reviews.Author: gadget-o-holic
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at Best Buy and ultimately ended up returning it.  I'm came from a 1080p Epson Projector that projected on to a 100" screen.  I had decided that I wanted to try the newer LED tv's out since we were moving anyway and did not want to bring the projector with us to our new home.I primarily looked at two TV models when I was looking in to TV's, the Samsung UN60F8000 and the LG 55GA7900.  I actually bought and tested both of the TV's out.  Below is a short Pros/Cons review and conclusion on both TV's.LG 55GA7900-------------------------Pros- Price... much cheaper than the F8000- Google TV integration for Apps (apps to enable airplay/etc)- Decent picture quality- Awesome remoteCons- No ARC capability for HDMI audio passthrough- Plex app does not play 3D SBS files- Not all apps in google play store are available- Google TV interface for Tivo integration not the bestSamsung UN60F8000-------------------------Pros- Awesome picture quality- Innovative, if somewhat limited, remote (would like more dedicated buttons and a QWERTY keyboard- ARC capability!!! Can use single HDMI cable to pass 5.1DD and DTS audio back to receiver from apps like Plex, Amazon Instant Video, and Netflix- Built in Skype and camera- Built in Plex app supports 3D SBS files natively!!!Cons- Limited app selection (though the essential apps are there - Plex, Skype Amazon Instant Video, Netflix)- Price... would have liked it to be a few hundred cheaper- ARC setup is not intuitive and there is limited documentation on how to get it set upCONCLUSION-------------------------After testing both TV's I ended up keeping the Samsung UN60F8000.  Although I was impressed with many of the bells and whistles that the GA7900 provided, I ultimately did not find many of the features to be useful and I found many of the apps were a little buggy and the interface was not entirely intuitive.  I really only use my TV to do 2 things... watch TV and watch movies from Amazon/Netflix/Plex.  Everything else is really unnecessary for me as I find that browsing the internet and things like that are better suited for a tablet or laptop.  Overall, the F8000 seemed like a better TV for my purposes, plus I really like that I can use HDMI ARC to send 5.1 and DTS signals to my receiver when watching movies through netflix/amazon or Plex.  The final plus for me with the F8000 is that the Plex app is much better IMO than on the GA7900.  The plex app on the Samsung F8000 comes pre-installed and can play 3D movies natively whereas the GA7900 using the plex app could not play the same 3D movie.  I couldn't be happier with my TV choice... if you use plex and need HDMI ARC the F8000 seemed to be one of the few TV's that could actually send 5.1 and DTS signals over the ARC interface.

Reviews.Title: false advertising
Reviews.Author: SJ
Reviews.Content: Amazon listed Miracast and NFC as features of this otherwise nice google tv...LG also lists those features for this model tv.Having owned, struggled with, and then returned, this tv, I must say it has neither Miracast nor NFC... (i own a nexus 4, so I could have used both features)I spent some time researching online and contacted both LG and amazon.  I received no answer.It's such a shame, with google tv and miracast, this product could have been great... without miracast it severely limits the possibilities.Maybe with a software update the feature could be enabled, but I wouldn't hold my breath.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV with unlimited viewing!!
Reviews.Author: Alex v.
Reviews.Content: This tv is definitely ahead of its time! There's nothing u can't watch on this, if u don't have a channel you want to watch just simply go online and stream live tv. It's so hard not to miss out on sporting events now! Also the menu on this tv is so amazing it's like a giant tablet and it's so easy to find things.

Reviews.Title: LG 55 inch
Reviews.Author: Tim Bell
Reviews.Content: So far the tv works up to all aspects. We haven't tried all of the features yet, but time will tell,

Reviews.Title: Great Picture! 3D is Awesome!
Reviews.Author: M. Holley
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning all the features of this gorgeous TV.  The image is spectacular!  I love the edge-to-edge picture. I was concerned about the increased size, but not having the "picture frame" styling made it comparable to the dimensions of the 46 inch TV it replaced.  The sound is quite good for a flat-panel TV. (Sound purists will want a separate speaker system.)I have not yet tried all of the apps that came embedded with the TV.  The minimalist documentation ("attach this here") gives me no clues about what is possible on this hybrid TV cum computer.  I have not yet found a way to play my MP4 files, which I was able to do with my previous TV. Very disappointing.  There are places to plug in a USB stick, but the system doesn't recognize it as an input device.  Maybe one of those many apps?  Sure would like to have better documentation!

Reviews.Title: The best TV ever.
Reviews.Author: Dawid  Broda
Reviews.Content: We did not even had an TV signal connected for moths. Easy to use apps and browser 100% substituted the Cable or Satellite TV set

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Julio R. Lopez
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is excellent.  I am still learning how to use the apps but if you have an android phone it is very intuitive.

Reviews.Title: I love this LG
Reviews.Author: K. Cox
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing TV, Love everything about it. The picture is sharp, and the 3D is truly spectacular! WOW!

Reviews.Title: It does what it says...
Reviews.Author: M. Kelly
Reviews.Content: For the amount of money you spend on something like this I would expect more user friendly interfaces. The "magic qwerty" key board remote is just awkward. Worst thing (for me), is that Hulu Plus is not an installed app. The menus are overly intricate to easily get to what you want quickly. All the other things you have read are true, great screen, 3D is great if you want to use it (preloaded content is just okay), and sound is good, some reviews said it was bad, but I don't hear any problems.

Requesting Amazon to remove this from the site's "ADDITIONAL FEATURES" which has misguided me.2.Crackle App - Free Movie channel  has been removed and cannot find it in Play Store via TV.3.Though Chrome Browser is displayed in the big Screen it display small mobile phone's compatible browser.4.Flash is not supported.will be continued ...

Reviews.Title: I would buy this again
Reviews.Author: Gert Walter
Reviews.Content: After we had to return our first one that came damaged and unusable, the new one is great.  User friendly, easy to set up, works better than promised.  Only quibble is that the qwerty keyboard would be much more functional if back lit.

Reviews.Title: Great Full featured smart TV
Reviews.Author: Jason Turner
Reviews.Content: I was deciding between this model and a comparable 55 incher by Samsung, and pulled the trigger on this one due to price.Pros:Appearance-  The slim bezel and the included stand are very nice. The glowing LG logo at the bottom is a nice touch too.Picture quality-  Amazing picture quality for the most part. Watching Blu-Rays and HDTV channel is a very crisp and clear picture in comparison to other models in this price range. There's a large amount of fine tuning you can do to adjust the picture to your liking if you have the patience, but if you're like me the picture wizard is the way to go. The only time I saw a dip in picture quality was when watching netflix on the built in app, but I think that can be fixed with a software update in the future.The Remote-  At first I thought this remote would be gimmicky, but after having this TV for almost 3 months and realizing what the remote can do, I stand corrected!  The remote is a perfect companion to this TV; I find myself using the voice commands and the qwerty keyboard more and more.Smartphone Connectivity-  I have a Samsung Galaxy S4 and it works flawlessly with this phone.  You can pick a YouTube video from your phone and instantly send it to the TV for your viewing pleasure.  There's also an app in the Google Play Store that allows you to use your phone as the remote, without losing ANY of the features of the included remote!Cons:Built In Apps-  Granted, there are a bunch of apps already installed on the TV.  However, most of them either take too long to load or are a pain to navigate.  As mentioned before, the netflix app has some picture quality issues and is sluggish when starting up tv shows and movies.  The Youtube app doesnt have any sluggish buffering, but searching for videos to watch is a nightmare. This is why I use my phone to search for videos, and then send the video to the TV from my phone.Sound Quality-  Kind of a given. most flat panel TVs dont sound that great cause of the small speakers.  This one isnt any worse than the rest, but definitely get yourself some external speakers.Pro AND Con: 3DI didn't buy this TV for the 3D capabilities but I have bought a few 3D blu rays to check it out.  Firstly, the 3D quality on Blu-rays is pretty awesome. You can adjust the depth to your liking, and on the most extreme setting some images really pop out.  The included glasses are super lightweight, making them easy to wear for long movies.  I did notice some crosstalk while watching movies, especially using the 2D to 3D mode.  That's why I knock the 3D a little bit b/c the crosstalk can be very distracting.

Reviews.Title: Everything's good so far
Reviews.Author: Kishan Jeter
Reviews.Content: Was able to purchase this tv brand new from Micro Center for $899 and so far so good! I'm not a fan of the IR Blaster feature where it attempts to allow you to control other items connected to you tv. I don't like that it requires an analog cable that sends some type of infrared signal or something?The Google TV remote control is really cool. I'm more excited that I was able to get it at great price.

Reviews.Title: LG 55GA7900 - Happy with my choice, but.....
Reviews.Author: David G. 12/24
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV at Best Buy for the same price advertised here on Amazon. I would have bought it on Amazon, but I didn't want to wait to get the TV and I'm leery of delivery services for high end electronics.I've had the TV for about 3 weeks and I'm very happy with my purchase. I researched buying a new TV for about 2 months and after countless visits to various websites, after reading endless reviews and after the umpteenth visit to my local Best Buy to look at the models that I had settled on researching I was down to the LG55GA7900 and the LG55LA7400. The deciding factor was the price. The Google TV was $200 cheaper and apart from the Google TV feature both sets are practically identical.The TV was a breeze to set up and looked beautiful straight out of the box! I fiddled a little bit with the picture settings and got it pretty close to where I want it but I gave in and bought the Disney WOW calibration DVD/Blu-Ray. Be ready to spend a couple of hours calibrating your TV because this tool is pretty detailed, even for novices.I've tried using the smart TV features and apart from the Netflix app most of the apps are ones that I'll probably never use. The HBO Go app is really a link to the website and it's not that great to use. All in all I'll stick with my PS3 for stuff like that.3D:The passive 3D on this set is amazing. I know alot of people don't care about 3D and I know there isn't that much 3D content available out there but if you purchase the 3D version of a Blu-Ray you will not be disappointed. I tried the 2D-3D conversion and it's a little gimmicky but it's kind of cool for sports. The 3D for gaming on my PS3 blew me away. I felt like I was playing old games for the first time!Magic Remote:I'm not a fan of the magic remote - the qwerty keyboard on the back is difficult to use in the dark - I'm probably going to purchase a universal remote.Picture:The picture on this TV is amazing! The options for adjusting the picture are plentiful.Sound:Definitely invest in a sound bar or a good surround sound system.WiFi:The TV comes with WiFi, but after 3 or 4 days it lost the signal to my router and I kept getting the message that it couldn't acquire a signal because it was too far from the source. My router sits 10 feet away from the TV. If you can run an ethernet cable I would suggest doing so - save yourself the headache.I am overall very pleased with my purchase aside from a very few minor things. For $1500 this is the best 3D LED TV on the market!

Reviews.Title: I love my new 3D TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful purchase this was.  I love how this tv works, love the google on the TV.  Just an awesome TV and I would recommend this TV to anyone thinking of purchasing a new 3D set.  I love LG and their technology.

Reviews.Title: 3d TV
Reviews.Author: Brian R.
Reviews.Content: Amazing TV.  Cool remote.  Easy to set up and use.  Has great apps but lacks Hulu Plus.  Also adapts really well to most formats on USB, external hard drives and home networks via Smartshare.

Reviews.Title: Probably the best value HDTV in the 2013 line; but what's with the pricing?
Reviews.Author: dookerJ
Reviews.Content: Was just getting ready to buy this tv when the price jumped 100$+ in a day. Perhaps it was on sale, but still... The pricing seems strange; it's now just a couple of hundred dollars off from the 55" model. Makes no sense.At any rate, this seems to be THE TV for 2013. Everyone including Vizio got rid of TruLED (local dimming) even on higher models, and QWERTY remotes are a must on a smart TV; those were ditched in Vizio and many other manufacturers.I loved my Vizio XVT series(about 3 years old; what happened to TVs in 2012-2013???)-true local dimming and slide out qwerty Bluetooth remote, but it's all been done away with in 2013, even on flagship models. Shame.So here we have 240hz, true local dimming, a kickass qwerty+motion remote, and a Google TV layer to boot.... For the "semi-budget" range this seems to take the cake unless you're in the Plasma camp.To me, this one is the value king for this year, where the Vizio XVT line was several years ago.Just wish they'd get the price back down to where it was before I put it in by cart.  It continually swings as much as several hundred dollars; it's as though they can't figure out how to price it.

Reviews.Title: 55GA7900- Great Deal so I made the leap.
Reviews.Author: JPleasant
Reviews.Content: I purchased the UN55F7100 from Best Buy and had it for about a week. I paid $1599 for it. I heard about the 55GA7900 on sale at MicroCenter for $999 and thought there was something up, especially since the TV is $1599 everywhere and now $1899 on Amazon. I had no problems with the Samsung. I returned it because LG is a great brand and saving $600 bucks is worth a try. I absolutely love the picture. It is a great mix of the dark tones of a plasma without losing the bright clear effect of an LED screen. I am a huge Samsung fan and I feel the LG picture surpasses Samsung. The picture is a five, but the Google TV is about 3.5-4 and thats probably because I'm just not a fan of Google's system. The Apps work well and after I installed a few updates, things got better such as response time etc. I am having a few issues pairing my Samsung sound bar so that I only use one remote, but I'll call LG about that. Having the Qwerty remote is so much better than I expected. I barely calibrated this TV as it was damn near perfect out of the box. GO TO MICROCENTER WHERE EVER YOU ARE BEFORE THE SALE ENDS. I asked the sales guy why so cheap and he said they bought way too much and that is actually company wide. I read a forum online and the sale appears to be everywhere. The great price also allows you to buy the warranty for $170 or $270 with screen protection.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE software
Reviews.Author: Edward Scott
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV three months ago. It was my first TV purchase. I am not happy with it.It was a smart TV or nothing for me. On paper the GA7900 looked great. Turns out it doesn't support everything they claimed, apps in general have very limited support for Google TV, the software is buggy, and the support is lousy.I'll detail three issues to support my rating. Any one of these would have been a dealbreaker for me if I had known ahead of time.HBO Go is an essential app for me. At the time I purchased both Amazon and LG claimed it was supported. At the time of writing Amazon still claims this. LG has since removed that detail from their site. If I try to install the app from the play store it claims my device is not supported. I'm not able to use the HBO Go website as it requires flash. I called LG support to inquire about this. The support guy claimed that HBO Go is a service not an app. (It was at this point that I got a VERY bad feeling about owning an LG product.) I very politely explained to him that, while it is a service you must subscribe to, there is an app with which you can use the service, and I was looking at it in the play store that very moment. The LG support guy couldn't offer an explanation. A separate email to LG support was responded merely that they are hoping HBO adds back support in future.I was pleased to see that I could install a Rhapsody app, but after some time ran into a problem where, while watching a movie on Amazon instant, if I unpause a movie by pressing the play button then Rhapsody also unpauses whatever music I was listening to earlier that day (even if the TV had been powered off since!). This is quite an alarming bug. I reported this to Rhapsody, who responded letting me know that LG Google TV is no longer supported. (LG TV is supported, but that is a different product.) Fortunately I can avoid this by unpausing movies by pressing the pause button a second time, but I am discouraged by the fact that Rhapsody abandoned support for this product.There is a live TV option that I had to enable in order to adjust some of the display settings. (That seems odd, right?) Since I don't have TV hooked up to it, I only stream from the internet, when I try to view live TV it shows the LG logo bouncing around the screen with a "No signal" message. On a couple of occasions I have been watching something on Netflix and that no signal bouncing logo appeared over the top of my video. Can you believe that?!? I had to power the TV off and on several times for it to stop. I reported this to LG support (during the same phone call in which I asked about HBO GO support). LG support told me I was just to restart my TV if that happened. That was all they offered. I asked if they were going to do anything to stop this happening. They said they could forward my request to engineering, who would follow up with me. I asked them to, but never heard back from them.There are some other minor gripes. Like, the Tune In app does not support this TV, and my favorite radio station won't work from the Tune In website on this TV. That wouldn't have stopped me buying, but is frustrating nonetheless.The hardware is fortunately pretty good, at least to my novice eyes and ears, so not all is lost. I can rely on my trusty Blu-ray player for a software-free TV or movie viewing experience. I am considering purchasing a Chromecast to get HBO Go support - as dumb as that it sounds to use a Chromecast on a Google TV, it may be necessary.

Reviews.Title: Takes some configuring, but then it's perfect
Reviews.Author: Ivy
Reviews.Content: For the image quality, I give it a 5.  You can have it dim in a dim room, which I find easier on the eyes.  It shows a crystal clear picture, and glorious 3D.  It's easily movie theater quality.For gaming, it supports dual screen with separate glasses LG Electronics AG-F310DP Cinema 3D Dual Play Gaming Glasses (2 Pair).  With this both players see their game full screen, in full HD.  I highly recommend this accessory for the gamer.The sound system is worth 5 stars if you set it up exactly right.  You can set the sound for wall mount or stand.  You can normalize the audio levels for extra clarity on the dialog.  There is an option to automatically sync the video to the audio.  The last two are turned off by default and you'll have a superior experience if you turn them on.  There are a lot of options, and it's worth the trouble to spend a little while playing with them until you get the configuration that works best for the acoustics of your room.  The TV is capable of excellent sound out of the box, but truly amazing audio once you have it turned just right.The TV is exceptionally clever at points.  ESPN 3D broadcasts on a top bottom split, so if the TV isn't in the correct mode, you see two images one above the other.  HBO on Demand 3D does it left and right.  With other TVs I've seen, you need to use the remote to tell the TV that it is supposed to be 3D and which mode it is being broadcast in.  This one initially shows the split screen, but figures it out and makes the switch itself in less than a minute.The remote is the weakest element.  You can use the pointer (think wii mote), and it has a nifty "shake to center" feature.  You can use the up and down arrows to point to your selection.  You can give it voice commands.  "Show Netflix" and "CBS".  You don't need to be precise so "Hulu" works the same as "Show Hulu". When you use the voice command and say "watch TV" the screen shows the phrase "live TV".  You do not want to say the phrase "live TV".  Just trust me on that one.  You can use the voice command to pull up the HDMI selection screen, but then you need to point and click to the one you want.  If it can't figure it out, say if you ask for "SyFy" for which there are multiple stations, it will show a list of best guesses.  If you ask for HBO, it will always bring you to HBO Go.On the plus side, the keyboard is convenient for searching, and the buttons are similar to those on a phone.  Integrating with other systems is done via IR blaster.  You sit an IR device over the IR receiver on the device you want to control and the TV pretends to be that device's remote.  It is good at pulling up the guide for your local programming provider, and changing channels, even without IR blaster.Overall, this TV falls somewhere between "Wow" and "Belongs on the Starship Enterprise".

Reviews.Title: Google TV is the future.  Great TV...a bit challenging to set up
Reviews.Author: Stephen "radman2020"
Reviews.Content: Pros:Fantastic picture3D which I thought was going to be a fad is fantastic.Bezel is very thinGoogle TV is the future. It is well integrated with this TV. Saying what I want and having the info pop up is fantastic.  The system isn't perfect (see below) but it is a whole new way of approaching TV...melding cable and online.Streaming over Wifi is perfect..Cons:  There are lots of these but they still don't override the ProsThe bezel is thin.  Even though this TV's screen is larger than the one it replaced, the TV is much smaller due to a smaller bezel.  It doesn't look as big and fill the space I had for it.  For others, this may be a plus.Setting up the TV was very difficult.  At first I couldn't get it to hook up to the internet. Turned out, It doesn't support WEP security.  The instructions don't say this and in fact the implication is that it does. You must use WPA or WPA2 (or no security).  I wasted hours figuring this out.It didn't seem to recognize my local fios.  It kept saying it didn't recognize any providers in my zip.  Then, inexplicably, after an hour, it worked.It got stuck in 3D mode every time I invoked it for a Fios movie.  It turns out that my receiver, only a couple years old, which is interposed between cable box and TV, doesn't support 3D fully.  It doesn't allow the TV to sense you are back in 2D mode.  The fix is to switch to another input and then return to the FIOS input (or unplug the HDMI cable and put it back.  I am not willing to spend a few hundred to replace an otherwise good entertainment receiver.  I found customer support very much available by phone but they couldn't figure it out.  I did.Even though Google TV promises to integrate the Verizon feed (regular TV), Netflix, Youtube, and Amazon... it leaves out one important source.  The ON DEMAND from the cable company.  Yes, I can voice search for ondemand and get the menus to search through...  if I search a movie or actor or whatever, I get lists of what is available from broadcast, Netflix, Youtube, amazon etc.  The only workaround is that you do get HBO GO in the search which replicates the HBO on demand.  It is streaming though...  which works fine but prob isn't as good resolution wise as the on demand.  There still is no good way to see all the movies and programs available in Ondemand without going laboriously through menu after menu.  I was hoping the google search would fix this.  It doesn't yet...but I am hoping.In the end, I don't think I would consider buying another big TV that didn't have google TV and 3D.  This is amazing even if it isn't perfect yet.  It will keep updating and hopefully become even better.This TV is highly recommended...but with the small overall size for a 46 incher due to the thin bezel, I wish I had a 55 incher!

Reviews.Title: No 1080P through HDMI!!!
Reviews.Author: Gregg R. Stauffer
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this TV, however, out of the box I recognized right away that there was something up with the picture quality. Not that the quality was terrible, it was "ok". But--it did not match the quality of the TV I was replacing.I have a DirecTV system. Anyone buying this TV who has a DirecTV system needs to understand this TV will not get the 3D DirecTV channels--ever. You will also--never--get 1080P on any programming through HDMI, you will get 1080i at best. I can tell the difference having had 1080P.This is from the technical specifications of the LG website: "HDMI: 1080i, Component: 1080p". Why LG would design a TV that does not pipe 1080P through HDMI is a mystery. I tried to get 1080P through component, this does not work with DirecTV.I contacted both DirecTV and LG support. Directv knew exactly what the issue was, saying it was a KNOWN issue with this LG model. LG support insisted there was nothing wrong with the TV and it was DirecTV's issue. This is true, the TV specifications states exactly what they are selling: A TV that DOES NOT transmit 1080P through HDMI.Bottom line, for the money I spent, I expect what should be a basic: 1080P through HDMI.
